attributes.action: Abolish Income Tax
attributes.background:
Income tax in the UK was introduced in 1799 as a TEMPORARY measure to fund the Napoleonic wars which ended in 1815. Income tax was abolished in 1816. 
It was later reinstalled in 1842 due to there being a growing deficit.
attributes.additional_details:
In today's society absolutely everything is taxed. For many people in minimum wage jobs this makes day to day survival a struggle. By abolishing income tax this would give them an extra £60-£80 a month which would be put towards improving their quality of life.
Many people could use this money to feed/clothe/shelter their families and as stated EVERYTHING is taxed therefore is there any need for income tax for everyone to prosper?

attributes.action: Make all care homes/care providers not for profit organisations
attributes.background: After many documentaries about undignified/unsafe  inadequate care homes, we need to do something. Most homes/services are understaffed under trained and underpaid due to the owners/providers wanting high profits. And the people that suffer are the residents/clients.
attributes.additional_details:
Panorama documentaries 
Cqc reports 
I have personally worked in care for many years and have experiences the poor quality first hand. It's about the time the government does something about it.

attributes.action: Reduce Vat on Post from outside the UK.
attributes.background: It is quite absurd that an item costing £19.00 ($22.00 US) should then incur a £14 odd vat and handling charge. The handling charge of £8 is placed by the Royal Mail regardless of size weight or cost of item, and is added for anything with VAT to be paid.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the Vat Charges on small items are hardly worth the cost of auditing and tracking the payments, it would probably be more cost effective to have a slightly higher cut off, this will also have the effect of reducing the resentment the British public have in paying the extraordinary large charge to the Royal Mail for low cost items.

attributes.action: Stop Supermarkets from using unnecessary packaging for fruits and veg.
attributes.background: Why wrap up avocados, cucumbers, bananas, potatoes, peppers, etc.? These can be easily displayed in supermarkets' shelves without the plastic as they have natural skin protection. This packaging will go straight to our bins which may end up in landfill or even in our rivers and oceans.
attributes.additional_details: Using packaging for fruit and veg that have natural skin protection is creating waste for the sake of waste. The misuse of plastics can be seen in supermarkets like Aldi, Asda, Tesco, Sainsbury's, Coop, etc. These companies need to take environmental responsibility and adopt sustainability as part of their corporate strategy.

attributes.action: Help release Iranian prisoner of conscience kept in solitary confinement 6 years
attributes.background: I am a student of Mohammad Ali Taheri and I was arrested in Iran in a peaceful demonstration in protest to his death sentence (UN Special Reporter March 2016 report: https://goo.gl/WWhzjPTo ). I have been campaigning for him for several years and I need the UK government's help to free him.
attributes.additional_details:
** http://www.auswaertiges-amt.de/DE/Infoservice/Presse/Meldungen/2016/161108-MRHH-Mohammad_Ali_Taheri.html?version=2
 
** https://www.gruene-bundestag.de/presse/pressemitteilungen/2016/november/iran-freiheit-fuer-mohammad-ali-taheri-15-11-2016.html

**http://www.petertatchellfoundation.org/tag/dr-taheri/

**https://www.amnesty.org.uk/blogs/urgent-action-network/my-teacher-needs-your-urgent-help

attributes.action: Make tractor drivers pass a HGV test due to to the weights tractors can now haul
attributes.background: Tractor tests have been very simple since the war, the machines themselves have got larger in comparison, the power and weight hauling capability has also increased, but the drivers exprience or knowledge has not. A tractor slid across a field with a near miss of children who were on adjacent land.

attributes.action: Stop parking charges at hospitals for visitors & staff, charges for TV & phone
attributes.background: I have been in hospital several times, cost £1.60 per hr, £7.50 per day for TV, 3 minute phone call cost £2.00. I am an OAP and cannot afford these prices.
attributes.additional_details: Being old I am in and out of hospital

attributes.action: HM Forces exempt Higher rate Stamp Duty on additional residential properties
attributes.background: The MOD have changed service personnels pensions, pay and allowances persistently for the worst over the last decade. To supplement their heavily reduced pensions on retirement service personnel in the past have built up property portfolios, the Government have now made this practically impossible
attributes.additional_details: In the Autumn Statement on 25 November 2015, the Chancellor of the Exchequer announced that higher rates of Stamp Duty Land Tax would apply from 1 April 2016 to purchases of additional residential properties, such as second homes and buy-to-let properties. With the Armed Forces numbers shrinking on a daily basis and recruitment drives failing this would be a big incentive for serving personnel to provide a return of service for exemption from Higher rates of Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT).

attributes.action: Debate why restaurants have so few allergy free options and why more isn't done
attributes.background: In many restaurants there's often only one or two gluten free options on a menu when could be more. For instance if chips were fried GF, as they would otherwise be GF. Instead often the same oil used for frying breadcrumb/batter based food to save money. There are other instances of this as well.
attributes.additional_details: It's reported 7% of U.K. population have a gluten allergy or intolerance, this affecting a few million people. There are a few restaurants that do make the effort and why not many more. For instance some restaurants use separate oil but many don't. This would very easily widen the choice when eating out with family and friends making it a much more enjoyable experience, which otherwise can be quite off-putting. This should also be debated on other allergies and what could be done to help.

attributes.action: Establish protocols for all new born babies with law bound practises.
attributes.background: Our youngest daughter was born with hyperextension in her right knee. The midwife refused to touch her and had no knowledge or experience of this condition. The physio didn't have experience, the health visitors ignored us when milestones were missed. How many other children were not being supported
attributes.additional_details:
After lots of nagging and persuasion we got the referrals we needed. At almost two she was finally getting the level of care she needed. The new physio told us that children as old as four were unable to walk- this lead us to question what happened to them?
The physio gave us the idea of the protocol. There are key documents supporting children with special educational needs and disabilities but they are no good without knowledge and guidelines for less well known conditions. MAKE PROTOCOLS LAW

attributes.action: issue an apology  to homosexuals who were criminalised  under indecency laws
attributes.background: Lives have been ruined, aspirations destroyed by cruel laws , in the armed forces men were unjustly punished for the crime of falling in love with another man,blacklisted as sex offenders a status that for years hung like a shadow , causing pain ,hurt ,mental health issues and astricisation

attributes.action: stop animal cruelty and any type of testing on animals
attributes.background: i think that there are many other ways to test and experiment with different products in a completely cruelty free way, the UK is part of the chain of the biggest animal cruelty users in the world for no apparent reason. Research will show you scientific ways to test out products without animal use.
attributes.additional_details: PETA is a strong animal cruelty free organisation that fight for the animals rights to their own freedom, not including harmful experiments. I also think that people of the public need to be more educated on this controversial topic to understand what actually happens when making their products that they use every single day.

attributes.action: Increase the number of years required to be eligible for UK citizenship
attributes.background: If refugees or persons with humanitarian protection can stay in the UK for 5 years and then be eligible for UK citizenship after 5 years, it discourages those from ever returning home once it is safe to do so.
attributes.additional_details: In Norway you have to wait 7 years, in Germany you have to wait 8 years, in Switzerland 10 years, and so on. I think there is a debate to be had about increasing the number of years to be eligible for UK citizenship.

attributes.action: Rebuild concorde as a bomber for RAF
attributes.background: We have no heavy bombers just jets and would be cheap as all ready have Airframe and Concorde is a great plane and supersonic .We can develope it to handle all bombs  .Great Britain needs to help the RAF get their heavy bomber
attributes.additional_details: Type RAF planes active duty your see no heavy bombers .We can not fight a large ground war without heavy bombers on our own if Europe falls

attributes.action: Agree to a second referendum on Scottish Independence
attributes.background: The actions of the UK government after the Brexit vote do not align with the people of Scotland. We are not bigoted. We are not racist. We welcome everybody based on their contribution, not on where they come from. The UK government does not behave in this way and so we must LEAVE.

attributes.action: Give retired police officers the authority to charge drivers using mobile phone
attributes.background: I spoke about this to a retired police inspector who thought it was a good idea , maybe they could get a part of the fine for there time taken to charge the person with the offence

attributes.action: Make it illegal for landlords todiscriminate against families with children.
attributes.background: Landlords should not be able to refuse to rent their propert to people based on whether they have children or not unless there is a safety issue. Many do not refuse on this basis and even stipulate criteria like 'one child only.' This practice should not be allowed to continue.

attributes.action: Bring in a law to stop any more buildings over 30 floors being built in London.
attributes.background: London isn't Manhattan. Our original environment is dwarfed by mega-towers that no-one lives in. Let's ask the Government to bring in planning law to prevent any more towers over 30 floors being built in Central London. Those extra floors aren't solving any housing crisis - just overseas investors
attributes.additional_details:
Guardian article on 50 story St George's Wharf tower - the blight of Vauxhall riverside: 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2016/may/24/revealed-foreign-buyers-own-two-thirds-of-tower-st-george-wharf-london
This Ipsos mori survey for Skyline Campaign suggests that lots of people agree with me: 
http://workplaceinsight.net/majority-of-londoners-support-greater-restrictions-on-new-tall-buildings/

attributes.action: Offer teachers salary sacrifice car scheme
attributes.background: Sources continue to raise awareness of the teacher shortage crisis. Even though there are initiatives to recruit new teachers, more needs to be done to retain the best teachers by offering incentives such as a car salary sacrifice schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/educationopinion/12182027/How-to-solve-the-teacher-recruitment-crisis.html

https://www.theguardian.com/education/2016/jul/26/secondary-schools-spent-56m-teacher-job-ads-labour

http://www.fleetnews.co.uk/news/fleet-industry-news/2015/06/01/government-to-consider-salary-sacrifice-car-schemes-for-teachers

attributes.action: Increase the restriction speed for 50cc mopeds to 60mph
attributes.background: I use 60mph roads on a regular basis. I have found that other road users grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass at dangerous points of which could easily result in a threat on my life as some cars overtake and narrowly avoid a head on crash
attributes.additional_details: I have been riding my 50cc motorbike for a few months now and I have to use 60mph/40mph roads on a regular basis on my way to school. I have found that other road users in larger vehicles grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass on corners and/or dangerously close to me. There have also been some that risk a head on crash in an attempt to pass. A faster speed in my eyes would eliminate the threat that other road users oppose to slower mopeds.

attributes.action: National vote to Legalise right to die
attributes.background:
Let there be a nationwide referendum to vote for the right to die,
In extreme circumstances A person should have the right to choose to legally and safely end their life

attributes.action: Reduce APD to bring it in line with other European countries.
attributes.background: For too long the UK has paid extortionate taxes on air travel - far higher than other countries. Reduce APD so that people can afford their well earned holidays.

attributes.action: Declare a national day of mourning when David Attenborough dies.
attributes.background: All non-essential services stop (most offices, shops etc) in order for all to stay home and watch his programmes.

attributes.action: Allow alternative advanced chemotherapy treatment in the UK
attributes.background: We have a very close friend who is terminally ill with cancer. Our dear friend Brigitta, who is a mother of 2 children, Marco and Denym and loving wife to Massi has fought this dreadful disease for 13 years and endured various forms of treatment. She is now in need of advanced specialist treatment
attributes.additional_details:
To enable Brigitta to live her life and feel slightly more normal again, we are having to raise £30,000 to send her overseas for specialist medical treatment which could really make a difference to her health and current situation. 
If this was to be available in the UK to Brigitta, then her family would not have the concerns they do about funds and could have this advanced treatment without having to rely so much on other peoples help. 
We are currently organising events and fundraising pages to help Brigitta through her journey, and hope we reach this goal to get her this treatment that she deserves.
Please help and support this worthy cause, and get this treatment into the UK!

attributes.action: Establish a National Burkini Day.
attributes.background: Swimming at beaches, in public or private pools is everyone's right.  Those who chose to do so in a Burkini should be encouraged to participate in such recreation.  Establishment of National Burkini Day would be in the best traditions of our great country.  Please support this petition.

attributes.action: Change the upgrading process for motorcycle licenses.
attributes.background:
On 19th January 2013 the motorcycle licence restrictions changed for new motorcycle riders. 

This meant that in order to upgrade from an A2 motorcycle license to an A motorcycle license requires the rider to pass the exact same test that they passed two years prior on an arbitrarily smaller bike.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst the tiered licensing system has its merits, and rightfully deserves to stay, a rethink on the upgrading process for riders must be considered.

If the automatic upgrade that was in place before the 2013 update is not satisfactory, perhaps some type of competency test on a larger motorcycle could be implemented, to ensure the rider's skills are still satisfactory - an advanced version of the CBT for riders with existing qualifications who wish to advance through their licenses.

attributes.action: Stop the minting of Copper Coins
attributes.background: There is very little that can be purchsed for 1p or 2p now, so it is pointless having these coins. It is also a waste of money minting them. If the lowest denomination of coin minted was 5p then everything could be priced at £x.95 instead of £x.99
attributes.additional_details:
New Zealand's smallest coin is the 10c which is approximately equivalent to 5p (GBP)
Australia has scrapped its 1c & 2c and its 5c coin is approximately equivalent to 3p (GBP)
In the USA it has long been known that minting the 1c coin actually costs more than 1c per coin.
Many people in the UK often throw away 1p & 2p coins as they are practically worthless.

attributes.action: Stop all Police cuts within the UK and increase high visibility patrols.
attributes.background: We need more police officers on the streets not police cuts

attributes.action: Put The Open Golf Championship back on free to air TV
attributes.background: This is the first time in 60 years The Open as not been broadcast on free to air TV. Signing the petition will help influence the government to make The Open Championship a group A protected listed sporting event. Live coverage of the event will then be offered to free to air broadcasters.
attributes.additional_details: The Open Championship dates back to 1860 and is the the world's most prestigious golf tournament and one of four golf majors. With the an international field of the world's best golfers competing for the top prize in golf. The coverage of The Open as been enjoyed by millions on the BBC for the last 60 years, inspiring viewers of all ages to go out and play golf. As a nation we should be proud to host this event and it should be celebrated as one of the great British sporting events.

attributes.action: Bring back national service
attributes.background: So the nation is ready for an unexpected attack or overseas war, also it would help to mold younger people to be more patriotic and proud of our great nation, it also teaches great life skills such as respect, team work, and patriotism and how to help ones self,
attributes.additional_details:
The older generation always say it should be brought back as it didn't do them any harm, 

also it would help against crime that the youth of today get involved in also the new threat of radicalization in the unhappy or troubled members of younger society the ones who think they are useless and have no calling in life, at least national service would unstil a sense of purpose,

attributes.action: Always send users of Class A substances such as heroin to rehab, not jail
attributes.background: Due to the horrific nature of addiction when it comes to substances such as Heroin and Crack cocaine I believe we should be giving users as much help as possible. These people need treatment, not punishment. Making it harder for them to get a job is also less likely to get them off these substances.

attributes.action: Install Average Speed Cameras the entire length of the A34 in Oxfordshire
attributes.background:
As reported on national news the A34 has had over 50 deaths in the last 5 years, a significant factor being excessive speed.
There have been calls to reduce the speed limit to 50mph, but regardless of this - there must be robust enforcement, which only a full Average Speed Camera system can achieve
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-oxfordshire-36750468

attributes.action: Reverse the agreement for the MOD to purchse helicopters from the USA
attributes.background: The UK helicopter manufacturers have a fantastic track record and in the present economic uncertainty of the UK it would be wrong to award the new fleet to US manufacturers.  The UK has proved over many many years that they could fulfil the MODs requirements.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from the outside lane.
attributes.background: Heavy goods vehicles in the outside lane are a danger to other road users as well as causing huge backlogs of traffic while they attempt overtaking moves at little more than the speed of the vehicle in the inside lane.Cars only in the outside lane please
attributes.additional_details: Last week when leaving Felixstowe docks on the A14 I followed a heavy goods vehicle for 15 miles in the outside lane while they attempted to overtake another HGV which was in the inside lane. A huge queue of cars had built up behind me as the trucks rolled on side by side at virtually identical speed. Very frustrating for other motorists and also dangerous. These heavy vehicles with restricted speed limit should stay in the inside lane at all times

attributes.action: Terrorism: victim family members to be invited on independent commission.
attributes.background: When acts of terrorism occur, victim family members should be given the opportunity to be part of an independent commission (funded by the UK government), to ensure there is a full & proper investigation into the death of their loved ones.

attributes.action: Pursue a tariff free trade deal and free movement of people deal with the USA
attributes.background: We have been allies for a long time and we would highly complement each other to be able to trade and move freely for purposes of work and or family reuniting purposes, students should still be under student visas however!
attributes.additional_details: My own example is my wife and I married over in the USA 15/04/2011 due to unrealistic income requirement have been apart for 5 years of our marriage we have had just 9 months together 3 in USA and 6 in the UK, she has vast experience in care and in hotel management and retail so could get a job here, I am easily able to gain work there as a PSV driver and HGV and or in gaining EMT state certification there to gain employment! Both of us would have to file taxes in our own countries even if zero!

attributes.action: Call a General Election once the new Conservative leader has been selected.
attributes.background: The EU referendum result has left the current government with no backup plan. This petition therefore asks for a General Election to be called so that the parties can set out their positions with regard to EU negotiations. The new government can then go forward with a new mandate and clear plans.
attributes.additional_details: For better or worse, if the UK leaves the EU, we will be entering an unfamiliar economic and diplomatic landscape. A General Election would give the nation an opportunity to debate the implications of the vote and our place in the world. It may not be legally required but, given the vast implications of the referendum result, a General Election is surely a moral and democratic necessity. The future direction of the whole country should not be decided by the members of any single political party.

attributes.action: Put an end to the driving theory process.
attributes.background: The driving theory test that is required in the UK is a complete nonsense. It wasn't deemed necessary in former years and it shouldn't be relevant now. Why should a memory test dictate whether you are suitable to drive? It is simply a money making scheme, which is highly unfair on young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Problems:
- Memory based.
- Favours those who prefer exams conditions.
- It keeps competent young drivers off the roads.
- It drains the money of millions of young people
- It wasn't deemed important years ago so why is it important now?

attributes.action: Make unsecured debt remedies available for child support arrears.
attributes.background: According to Gingerbread, the CSA has left almost £4bn of outstanding arrears, with the DWP’s estimating only £467m is ever likely to be recovered.
attributes.additional_details: According to Gingerbread's latest report, www.gingerbread.org.uk/content/2297/Missing-maintenance nearly half of single-parent families live below the poverty line and the number is increasing. Although the CMS charges for collection, it has only recovered 53% due (leaving£52.5m arrears) and less than half the eligible children getting anything. Its collection remedies are insufficient, particularly for the large number of self-employed/cash- in- hand owing parents.

attributes.action: If a petition gets 250,000 signatures, it should trigger a national referendum
attributes.background:
Engagement with politics is continuing to decline. Direct democracy is part of the solution. 

When an official petition receives around 250,000 signatures, it should result in an official, binding referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
In Switzerland, when around 0.6% of the population signs a petition, it triggers a referendum (https://www.ch.ch/en/referendum/). This system works well in a country of more than eight million people, and there is no reason why it wouldn't work well in the UK.

A committee or group should be set up to administer these petitions so they do not needlessly consume government time. Note that only a small number of petitions a year would receive the needed signatures.

attributes.action: Make Friday a Half working day
attributes.background: Gives everyone a longer weekend. People will be happier and less stressed.

attributes.action: In 2018 hold a referendum on whether negotiated EU Exit terms are acceptable.
attributes.background:
Suggested:
The UK will shortly be leaving the European Union; How should the UK continue trading with the EU? 
1. Trade on the terms of the draft Exit treaty  between the UK and EU? 
2. Trade with the EU only on World Trade Organization rules, until a better Trade Agreement with the EU is agreed?
attributes.additional_details:
This new referendum will seek to ensure that the will of the majority that voted to LEAVE is not watered down by weak UK negotiators who, to gain free trade arrangements, might give away the control of free-movement-of-labour that was voted for. 

Or secondly if the EU is dogmatic and unwilling to include UK control of movement-of-labour this vote effectively gives those who voted to REMAIN  a second referendum.

attributes.action: Britain should apply to become the 51st state of the United States of America
attributes.background: In light of the result of the EU Referendum held on Thursday 23 June and the immediate concomitant decline in the UK economy, it would be germain to enter into a stronger economic union with the United States of America at the earliest possible opportunity.
attributes.additional_details: Under Article IV, Section 3, of the US Constitution, any territory may apply to Congress to join the United States. As the 51st US state, Great Britain would gain all the economic and military backing of the US federal government whilst also being free to draft its own state constitution and effectively retain its sovereignty. This would have the added advantage of allowing the UK Government to invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty sooner than October in order to re-stabilise the EU economy.

attributes.action: Ensure the police can protect minority groups while the Brexit talks take place
attributes.background: In light of the recent increase in racist attacks in the immediate aftermath of the Brexit vote, we call on the government to condemn these attacks in the strongest language and ensure that the police have the resources to protect all our minority populations during the Brexit negotiations.

attributes.action: Make Imperial Units legal for trade and mandatory alongside Metric Units.
attributes.background: Due to a change in Britain's EU status, make it legal to trade in Imperial Units again and also mandatory to have Imperial Units alongside any existing Metric Units.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of the British public would still prefer to use Imperial Units (Oz, Lbs, Inch, Foot, °F) but European Parliament made it illegal to trade in Imperial Units back in 2000. Due to a change in Great Britain's status in the EU many people would like the right to trade in Imperial Units and also have food packaging etc labelled in duel Units (Metric and Imperial) this is in the interests of everybody as many like to use Metric and many like to use Imperial

attributes.action: 2nd referendum for 16-50 year olds
attributes.background: Almost two thirds of over 60s voted in favour of Brexit and those under 49 voted to remain (according to advance polling). Three quarters of people aged 18-24 voted to remain. It is not fair that the older generation have dominated a large percentage of votes and decided the future for the young.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics from Buzzfeed article: https://www.buzzfeed.com/patricksmith/young-people-are-angry-at-old-people-for-voting-leave?utm_term=.eo43KzXBMe#.eo43KzXBMe

attributes.action: Make swimming lessons in Secondary Schools optional
attributes.background: Pupils in Secondary schools are being forced to take part in swimming lessons, being told it 'isn't optional', despite most children being taught how to swim in Primary school. Adolescents should be given the choice whether they want to swim or not, as some are not comfortable doing so.
attributes.additional_details: Older children are being forced to wear swimming costumes and swim in a group with their peers, which can often cause distress, particularly to adolescents having their period who may be forced to wear tampons, or those not comfortable with wearing such clothing in front of others.

attributes.action: We would like to propose that May 1st be officially recognised as Union Day.
attributes.background: On the 1st May 1707 Parliament officially recognised the union of Great Britain
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acts_of_Union_1707

attributes.action: Give the right to children to argue their case in schools
attributes.background: In schools, teachers have complete over-riding control over what children say. If they are falsely accused of doing something which they believe they have not done, or they do not believe they do not deserve a certain punishment, it is labelled as "talking back."
attributes.additional_details: This is a petition to allow children to be able to freely argue their case with a neutral member of staff present in order to make sure that they receive a fair sanction. I have witnessed cases of children not being listened to and having to email the teacher to be heard. Sign for your child's rights.

attributes.action: To have the 23rd June declared an official day of mourning.
attributes.background: To demonstrate to the people who voted us out of the European Union, that we do not consider the 23rd June a cause for celebration.
attributes.additional_details: To be taken out of the European Union is an extremely serious step with catastrophic consequences and there are at least 16 million people who agree with me.  We are not going to be forced to make this move without some form of protest at the least.
